name: Yngwie the 1st Online Trivia | Yngwie Malmsteen | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was Yngwie's full, original name?
questions.explanation:
Lars Johann Yngwie Lannerback.

	This was his original name. When his parents split, he took his mother's maiden name and shortened it to the Yngwie Johann Malmsteen that we all know.

questions.text: What model of guitar was the guitar known as 'The Duck' or 'Play Loud'?
questions.explanation:
1972 Fender Stratocaster.

	Blond-coloured and bought when he was about 15. Was with him for a large portion of the early part of his career.

questions.text: How many Marshall quad-boxes form Yngwie's live set up?
questions.explanation:
27.

	12 on either side of the stage and 3 under the drum riser (talk about a rumble from beneath).

questions.text: What was the name of the 'Guitar Player' magazine contributor who gave Yngwie his first big break?
questions.explanation:
Mike Varney.

	Varney was also the co-founder of Shrapnel Records (BTW, I'm not even sure if Frank Redwhistle is real, my sister just blurted the name out).

questions.text: What Bach-inspired technique does Yngwie utilize?
Who did the vocals on the albums 'Rising Force' and 'Marching Out'?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Scott Soto.

	An easy one for fans.

questions.text: What type of picks does he use?
A portion of what Pagini piece appears as a prelude to 'Prophet of Doom'?
questions.explanation:
Caprice 24.

	Pagini was a huge influence on YJM.
